attributes.action: Impose covid testing for all UK arrivals from China
attributes.additional_details:
To protect their populations, other countries such as the US and Germany have introduced pre-departure screening.

The UK should act fast to impose pre-departure and arrival screening, with a short quarantine until results are available, to protect our most vulnerable from a new onslaught of this disease.
attributes.background:
The number of covid cases in China is rising rapidly, and given the population of this country, there is a high chance for vaccine resistant mutatations to become prevalent.

We must reduce the chance of these mutations entering the UK.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that passengers arriving from China to England will need to show a negative COVID-19 pre-departure test taken no more than 2 days prior to departure.

In addition, the UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) is launching surveillance which will see a sample of passengers arriving in England from mainland China tested for COVID-19 at the point of their arrival.

You can find out more about these measures here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/precautionary-and-temporary-measures-introduced-to-improve-covid-surveillance-from-china
